description: 1952, apparently from Gussy (adjective), schoolyard slang for “overly dressed” (1940); perhaps related to gussie (“effeminate man”) (1901) and somehow connected to Gussie, the nickname for Augusta and Augustus.

verbs.description: gussy (third-person singular simple present gussies, present participle gussying, simple past and past participle gussied)

entries.meaning: (chiefly US) To dress up or decorate in a showy way.
